overview_of_class: This course is the first of a three-course sequence that is completed by CHEM 210-B in the Winter Quarter, and CHEM 210-C in the Spring Quarter. Basic concepts of organic chemistry will be presented, including hybridization, resonance, nomenclature, stereochemistry, and reaction mechanisms. The preparation and reactions of alkyl halides, alkenes, alkynes, and alcohols will also be covered. There will be additional lectures on Saturday mornings, 9:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m., to be arranged once the quarter begins.
name: Organic Chemistry
title: SCS CHEM 210-A-65 Organic Chemistry

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is the first of a three-course sequence that is completed by CHEM 210-B in the Winter Quarter, and CHEM 210-C in the Spring Quarter. Basic concepts of organic chemistry will be presented, including hybridization, resonance, nomenclature, stereochemistry, and reaction mechanisms. The preparation and reactions of alkyl halides, alkenes, alkynes, and alcohols will also be covered. There will be additional lectures on Saturday mornings, 9:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m., to be arranged once the quarter begins.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Completion of Chem 103-CN and Chem 123-CN with a grade of C- or better; or equivalent transfer credit and permission of the department

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
In-class responses to "clicker" questions
Evaluation from the laboratory theory component of the course (Saturday mornings)
Two Midterm Exams
Final Exam

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Required

Organic Chemistry by L.G. Wade, 8th Edition, Pearson
Turning Technologies Model QT or NXT Response Card ("Clicker")

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Recommended

Solutions Manual for Organic Chemistry by L.G. Wade and Simek, 8th Edition, Pearson
Molecular Modeling Kit

subject: CHEM
